abstract_summ: The best predictive model predicts the confirmed cases to be in the range of 35000 70000 with the number of reported COVDI-19 deaths to be between 3000 5000 and 5000 30000 of recovered cases.To estimate the unidentified infected population, we find the optimal model parameters which best fit the confirmed case data in the least-squares sense.Objective: To evaluate novel coronavirus pneumonia cases by establishing the mathematical model of the number of confirmed cases daily, and to assess the current situation and development of the epidemic situation, so as to provide a digital basis for decision-making.In this article, we propose the Susceptible-Unidentified infected-Confirmed (SUC) epidemic model for estimating the unidentified infected population for coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) in China.Here, we use the time series data of the confirmed cases in China reported by World Health Organization.
title_summ: Application of COVID-19 pneumonia diffusion data to predict epidemic situationModeling the Corona Virus Outbreak in IRANAsymptomatic infection and herd immunity of COVID-19 in Wuhan and JapanFirst peak of COVID-19 outbreak in Japan might pass as of April 26, 2020Forecasting Novel Corona Positive Cases in Indiausing Truncated Information: A Mathematical ApproachExtended SIR prediction of the epidemics trend of COVID-19 in Italy and compared with Hunan, ChinaEstimation of Infection Rate and Prediction of Initial Infected Individuals of COVID-19The Susceptible-Unidentified infected-Confirmed (SUC) epidemic model for estimating unidentified infected population for COVID-19Prediction of Epidemic Peak and Infected Cases for COVID-19 Disease in Malaysia, 2020
title_abstract_phrases: Application of COVID-19 pneumonia diffusion data to predict epidemic situationObjective: To evaluate novel coronavirus pneumonia cases by establishing the mathematical model of the number of confirmed cases daily, and to assess the current situation and development of the epidemic situation, so as to provide a digital basis for decision-making.To estimate the unidentified infected population, we find the optimal model parameters which best fit the confirmed case data in the least-squares sense.The best predictive model predicts the confirmed cases to be in the range of 35000 70000 with the number of reported COVDI-19 deaths to be between 3000 5000 and 5000 30000 of recovered cases.The proposed model is simple but potentially useful in estimating the unidentified infected population to monitor the effectiveness of interventions and to prepare the quantity of protective masks or COVID-19 diagnostic kit to supply, hospital beds, medical staffs, and so on.The Susceptible-Unidentified infected-Confirmed (SUC) epidemic model for estimating unidentified infected population for COVID-19In this article, we propose the Susceptible-Unidentified infected-Confirmed (SUC) epidemic model for estimating the unidentified infected population for coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) in China.
